usage.sc-accordion:
## Single (default) By default only one `` element inside a `` can be expanded at any given time. When clicked on a different ``, the active one will be collapsed and the clicked one will be expanded. ```html Add active attribute to open an item by default. Lorem ipsum dolor sit Lorem ipsum dolor sit ``` ## Multiple ```html

Multiple

Lorem ipsum dolor sit Lorem ipsum dolor sit Lorem ipsum dolor sit ``` ## Nested ```html Lorem ipsum dolor sit Lorem ipsum dolor sit Lorem ipsum dolor sit Lorem ipsum dolor sit Lorem ipsum dolor sit ``` ## Customise it ```html
Use slot="heading" to customise heading
Lorem ipsum dolor sit
❤
Lorem ipsum dolor sit ```

props.name: multiple
props.docs: If multiple `<sc-accordion-item>`s can open at the same time

props.name: active
props.docs: If the accordion item should be opened by default

props.name: autoHeight
props.docs: If expanded height should be automatically calculated. If set, the `--sc-accordion-item-body-max-height` CSS variable will be set automatically to the content height

props.name: heading
props.docs:
Heading text.
This will be overwritten by `heading` slot

props.name: headingTag
props.docs:
The HTML tag to be applied to the heading text.
This will be overwritten by `heading` slot

docsTags.text: - Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.
docsTags.name: slot

usage.sc-button: Button Anchor Block Button Text Bordered button Flat button

props.name: active
props.docs: Set active state for the button

props.name: block
props.docs: Make button `display: block`

props.name: bordered
props.docs: If prop exists, button will have an engraved-styled border

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the button.

props.name: download
props.docs:
This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to
it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute
has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt
(the user can still change the file name if they want).

props.name: flat
props.docs: Make button flat

props.name: href
props.docs:
Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

props.name: icon
props.docs: Icon only button

props.name: iconText
props.docs: If this button has both icon and text

props.name: rel
props.docs:
Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

props.name: target
props.docs:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
Special keywords: `"_blank"`, `"_self"`, `"_parent"`, `"_top"`.

props.name: type
props.docs: The type of the button.

events.docs: Emitted when the button loses focus.
Emitted when the button is clicked.
Emitted when the button has focus.

styles.name: --sc-button-width
styles.docs: Set fixed width for button (default to auto)

slots.docs: Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.

props.name: bordered
props.docs: If this card has bordered style

props.name: cardSubtitle
props.docs: Subtitle of the card

props.name: cardTitle
props.docs: Title of the card

props.name: engraved
props.docs: if true, card will appear engraved instead of raised by default.

styles.name: --sc-card-bordered-width
styles.docs: Card border width (only applicable for bordered cards)

styles.name: --sc-card-inner-padding-y
styles.docs: Padding between title section and content section

styles.name: --sc-card-media-height
styles.docs: height of media part of the card

styles.name: --sc-card-media-width
styles.docs: width of media part of the card

styles.name: --sc-card-outer-padding-x
styles.docs: Horizontal outer padding of card. Default: calc(var(--sc-root-spacing) * 4);

styles.name: --sc-card-outer-padding-y
styles.docs: Vertical outer padding of card. Default: calc(var(--sc-root-spacing) * 4);

usage.sc-input:
<label for="email">Email</label>
<sc-input type="email" required name="email" id="email"></sc-input>

<label for="password">Password</label>
<sc-input type="password" required name="password" maxlength="6" id="password">
</sc-input>

<sc-input type="text"></sc-input>

props.name: accept
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `"file"`, then this attribute will indicate the types of files that the server accepts, otherwise it will be ignored. The value must be a comma-separated list of unique content type specifiers.

props.name: ariaLabelledby
props.docs: Aria labelby

props.name: autocapitalize
props.docs: Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

props.name: autocomplete
props.docs: Indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.

props.name: autocorrect
props.docs: Whether auto correction should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text value.

props.name: autofocus
props.docs: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

props.name: block
props.docs: Takes the entire width of the row

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

props.name: engraved
props.docs: Engrave level (0-9) note if 0 there will be no visible border around the element, so you'll need to add border via css.

props.name: inputmode
props.docs:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

props.name: max
props.docs: The maximum value, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

props.name: maxlength
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: min
props.docs: The minimum value, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

props.name: minlength
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: multiple
props.docs: If `true`, the user can enter more than one value. This attribute applies when the type attribute is set to `"email"` or `"file"`, otherwise it is ignored.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: pattern
props.docs: A regular expression that the value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

props.name: size
props.docs: The initial size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of the type attribute is `"text"` or `"password"`, in which case it is an integer number of characters. This attribute applies only when the `type` attribute is set to `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored.

props.name: step
props.docs:
Works with the min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a value can be set.
Possible values are: `"any"` or a positive floating point number.

props.name: type
props.docs: The type of control to display. The default type is text.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the input.

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.docs: Returns the native `<input>` element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs:
Sets focus on the specified `sc-input`. Use this method instead of the global
`input.focus()`.

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.
Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the input has focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.
Emitted when a key is pressed down

props.name: active
props.docs: When prop is set, this tab is shown, only one `<sc-tab>` element can be active inside `<sc-tabs>`

props.name: block
props.docs: The button shape.

props.name: bordered
props.docs: If prop exists, button will have an engraved-styled border

props.name: icon
props.docs: Icon only button

props.name: target
props.docs: id of the target `sc-tab-content` tag

usage.sc-tabs:
I'm dog tab

I'm cat tab

usage.sc-toggle:
<!-- Use it like a checkbox -->
<sc-toggle name="remember" value="1" checked="checked" label="Remember me"></sc-toggle>

props.name: ariaLabelledby
props.docs: aria labelby

props.name: autofocus
props.docs: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

props.name: checked
props.docs: If this toggle is on by default

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

props.name: label
props.docs: Label text to be displayed inline with the toggle

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: value
props.docs: The value of the input.

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.
Emitted when the value has changed.
Emitted when the input has focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input occurred.
Emitted when a key is pressed down
